unnormalised: Yo, car enthusiasts! The Indian auto scene is buzzing with new vehicle launches, and we're here to give you the lowdown!
normalised: Yo, car enthusiasts! The Indian auto scene is buzzing with new vehicle launches, and we are here to give you the lowdown!

unnormalised: First up, Mahindra just dropped the new Scorpio N Adventure Edition - perfect for tackling those Leh-Ladakh roads. They're boasting improved ground clearance and some serious off-roading chops. Expect prices to hover around Rs. 25 Lakh, give or take.
normalised: First up, Mahindra just dropped the new Scorpio N Adventure Edition - perfect for tackling those Leh-Ladakh roads. They are boasting improved ground clearance and some serious off-roading chops. Expect prices to hover around rupee twenty five lakh, give or take.

unnormalised: Tata Motors ain't sleeping either! Rumor has it they're prepping a Harrier EV, expected to be unveiled near Diwali. Range anxiety? Forget about it, sources say it's aiming for 500 km on a single charge.
normalised: Tata Motors is not sleeping either! Rumor has it they are prepping a Harrier E V, expected to be unveiled near Diwali. Range anxiety? Forget about it, sources say it is aiming for five hundred kilometer on a single charge.

unnormalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki quietly launched a limited edition WagonR CNG. Dr. Sharma from our team spotted it at a dealership in Karol Bagh - packed with extra features and a jazzed-up interior.
normalised: Meanwhile, Maruti Suzuki quietly launched a limited edition Wagon R C N G. Doctor Sharma from our team spotted it at a dealership in Karol Bagh - packed with extra features and a jazzed-up interior.

unnormalised: And finally, remember that snazzy Kia concept we saw at the Auto Expo? Well, they're planning to bring a smaller version to India. Expect it to compete in the sub-4 meter SUV segment. The manufacturing plant in Andhra Pradesh is expanding by 200,000 sq ft to accommodate the new production line! Stay tuned for more updates!
normalised: And finally, remember that snazzy Kia concept we saw at the Auto Expo? Well, they are planning to bring a smaller version to India. Expect it to compete in the sub-four meter S U V segment. The manufacturing plant in Andhra Pradesh is expanding by two hundred thousand square feet to accommodate the new production line! Stay tuned for more updates!
